marketNews.title: Danantara Plans Restructuring & Consolidation of State-Owned Enterprises Until End 2025
marketNews.content:
COO of Danantara, Dony Oskaria, said on Wednesday (23 July) that the entity has 22 work programs to be carried out until the end of 2025. Although not explained in detail, Dony stated that the programs cover restructuring, consolidation, and business development of state-owned enterprises (SOEs), consisting of:

1. Restructuring in 4 sectors: airline business, steel manufacturing, high-speed rail, and insurance.
2. Consolidation of businesses in 9 sectors: construction, fertilizer, hospitals, hotels, sugar, oil downstream, insurance, asset management, and industrial estates.
3. Business development targeting cooperative sector, food, batteries, cement, sharia banking, telecommunications, and shipyard industry.

Regarding the consolidation plan for BUMN Karya, Dony said the entity will consolidate subsidiaries that are not directly related to the core business. The BUMN Karya consolidation plan is not new, as the discussion has been present since 2023.

Meanwhile, Member of DPR Commission VI, Ahmad Labib, reminded Danantara to avoid a conglomerate model in implementing the consolidation and transformation program. Ahmad said that the conglomerate model previously applied to SOEs was unproductive and often a source of inefficiency in the past.

Kontan reported that Danantara and Commission XI of DPR also held a closed meeting on Wednesday (23 July). Chairman of Commission XI, Mukhamad Misbakhun, explained that the meeting was held in closed session because some information conveyed by Danantara was feared to affect the market, as the information was considered insider.

Key Takeaway:
The success of Danantara in revitalizing and developing SOEs can strengthen Danantara’s own capitalisation. However, execution is the key factor that investors need to watch, besides the details of the programs/schemes to be implemented.

Since Danantara’s launch on 24 February 2025, the overall sentiment for SOE stocks has been fairly positive. Since that date, the IDX BUMN20 index has risen by 6.24%, with $ANTM (+85%), $PGEO (+69%) and $PTPP (+53%) as the top three issuers with the highest share price gains. The IDX BUMN20 increase is higher than IDX30 (+3.58%) and LQ45 (+3.88%), which are more concentrated on large SOE banks.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics
marketNews.content:
1. DPR approved the results of the discussion on the RAPBN 2026 posture on Thursday (24 July), targeting a deficit of about 2.48-2.53% of GDP. The posture assumes economic growth of approximately +5.2-5.8% YoY, inflation of about 1.5-3.5% YoY, the rupiah exchange rate of 16,500-16,900 per US dollar, a 10-year SBN yield of 6.6-7.2%, Indonesia Crude Oil price of US$60-80 per barrel, oil lifting of 605-620 thousand barrels per day, and gas lifting of 953-1,017 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day.

2. The spokesperson of the Ministry of Coordinating Economic Affairs, Haryo Limanseto, said on Wednesday (23 July) that the government plans to continue the economic stimulus package in Q3 2025 to maintain economic growth. The package will be finalised this week and will continue the stimulus of 24.4 trillion rupiah that was released in June-July 2025.

3. The Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Tri Winarno, said that the ministry asks mining companies to submit a new work plan and budget (RKAB) for the 2026 period in October 2025, following the approval to change the RKAB duration from every three years to every one year.

4. Reuters reported that the European Union and the United States are close to a trade deal that will reduce US tariffs on EU goods from 30% to 15%, a level similar to the US-Japan agreement. Both the EU and the US are also reported to eliminate tariffs on several products, including aircraft, alcoholic beverages, and medical equipment. No comment has been given by either side.

5. Samudera Transport ($PSAT) announced that it has sold four company vessels to non-affiliated parties for a total of 22 billion rupiah. The sale includes two tugboats and two barges, intended for vessel regeneration to reduce maintenance costs.

tickerNews.title: Djarum Group Entity Acquires Treasury Shares of SSIA
tickerNews.content: SSIA (Surya Semesta Internusa) announced that the Djarum group entity PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan acquired approximately 62.9 million treasury shares of the company on 22 July 2025 at a price of 2,700 rupiah per share, about 3.8% higher than SSIA’s share price on Thursday (24 July). The treasury shares represent 1.34% of the ownership stake and after the transaction SSIA no longer holds treasury shares. PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan itself holds 7.36% of SSIA shares, according to KSEI data as of 22 July 2025.

tickerNews.title: Commissioner Chandra Daya Investasi Purchases 15 Million Shares of CDIA
tickerNews.content: Commissioner Chandra Daya Investasi, Andre Khor Kah Hin, bought 15 million shares of CDIA at an average price of 800 rupiah per share on 17 July 2025. The total transaction value reached 12 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Andre Khor Kah Hin’s direct ownership in CDIA increased from zero to 0.012%.

tickerNews.title: BSDE Reports 1H25 Marketing Sales of 5.1 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales of 2.7 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+1% YoY, +9% QoQ). This result made the 1H25 marketing sales reach 5.1 trillion rupiah (+5% YoY), equal to 51% of the 2025 target of 10 trillion rupiah. The 1H25 marketing sales contributors were residential segment (43%), followed by retail (25%), commercial (15%), land plot sales to joint ventures (12%), and apartments (5%). BSDE explained that the solid performance in 1H25 provides a strong foundation for the company to pursue its annual target, reinforced by the Bank Indonesia rate reduction policy.

tickerNews.title: NICL Announces Interim Dividend 2 for FY 2025
tickerNews.content: PAM Mineral announced that it will distribute its second interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 amounting to 159.5 billion rupiah or 15 rupiah per share. This amount indicates a dividend yield of 1.2% as of Thursday (24 July). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on 1 August 2025, with payment on 12 August 2025. Previously, NICL also distributed an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of 15 rupiah per share on 30 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: JSMR Gains Sole Control Over PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo
tickerNews.content: Jasa Marga announced a change in control of PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo to become solely controlled by JSMR. Previously, PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo was under joint control together with Adhi Karya ($ADHI). The change in control was effected through an amendment to the shareholders’ agreement, resulting in no transaction value arising. After this change, JSMR will consolidate PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo in its financial statements. PT Jasamarga Jogja Solo holds the concession for the Solo-Yogyakarta-NYIA Kulonprogo toll road, which will now be solely controlled by JSMR.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Posts 2Q25 Net Loss of 6 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: PT PP recorded a net loss of 6 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-89% YoY, -90.1% QoQ), resulting in a net loss for 1H25 of only 65 billion rupiah (-56% YoY). Revenue in 2Q25 fell to 3.2 trillion rupiah (-23.5% YoY, -8.7% QoQ), leading to a 1H25 revenue decline of 23.7% YoY to 6.7 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: CGAS Projects LNG Facility Revenue and 2025 Outlook
tickerNews.content: Business and Kompas reported that the LNG facility owned by Citra Nusantara Gemilang in Karawang, West Java, has the potential to add approximately 120 billion rupiah per year in revenue for the company, equivalent to 23.6% of total 2024 revenue. The facility is targeted to be operational by the end of 2026. Additionally, CGAS’s President Director, Andika Purwonugroho, said the company is optimistic to achieve around 650 billion rupiah in total revenue in 2025, representing a growth of about 28% YoY compared to the 2024 realization, driven by the operation of three new compressed natural gas (CNG) stations this year.
